application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: To carry out tree surgery including a height reduction by 2/3m to Two Ash (T1 and T2 on application) and to monolith by removing crown One Ash (T3 on application), all within Group 1 on TPO 648
decision_conditions: The group of Ash trees is located within the back garden of Tanglewood Highfield Close. These trees are part of a larger group of Ash trees which are all protected. The group of trees is also comprised within the Area of Special Local Character of Old Northwood, and represents an important feature for the local landscape. The group of trees significantly contribute to the local amenity of the area by providing a mature tree cover for the residents of adjacent properties. The trees also represent an important feature for the local biodiversity, by providing habitat for wildlife.

The applicant has asked permission to reduce by 2/3 tree 1 and 2 and has provided "Ash dieback" as reasons for the proposed crown reduction but has not supplied any arboricultural evidence for this statement, as no arboricultural assessment has been provided. The applicant also has not provided specific reasons for the proposed complete removal of the crown to monolith on T3 in the group as opposed to the crown
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981:  Note that it is an offence under this act to disturb roosting bats, nesting birds or any other protected species.
